message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.MM

This paper involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques to analyze closed captions of television news programs. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) methods to process and annotate the captions, making cs.IR a likely sub-category as well. The analysis of linguistic style and biases can be considered as a machine learning (ML) task, which falls under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves multimedia analysis, which can be categorized under cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper discusses the biases in news providers and people in the news, which can be considered as a social impact (SI) of technology, making cs.SI a possible sub-category.
